intro: Catoblastus microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited catoblastus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pale green to yellowish in color, and the fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. It plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and birds.
